api.name: BeamParticipant
api.description: This class represents a user who is currently viewing a Beam Interactive stream. This user (also known as a Participant) can have both a Beam account and a Microsoft Security Account (MSA).

properties.description: Gets the Beam level of the user.
properties.name: BeamLevel
properties.property_description: The Beam level of the user.

properties.description: Gets the Beam ID of the user.
properties.name: BeamID
properties.property_description: The Beam ID of the user.

properties.description: Gets the Beam username of the user.
properties.name: BeamUserName
properties.property_description: The Beam username of the user.

properties.description: Gets or sets the group this participant is in. By default, participants are placed in a group named "default".
properties.name: Group
properties.property_description: The time (in UTC) at which the user last used the interactive control input.

properties.description: Gets the time (in UTC) at which the user connected to the Beam Interactive stream.
properties.name: ConnectedAt
properties.property_description: The time (in UTC) at which the user connected to the Beam Interactive stream.

properties.description: Gets the time (in UTC) at which the user last used the interactive control input.
properties.name: LastInputAt
properties.property_description: The time (in UTC) at which the user last used the interactive control input.

properties.description: Gets the value that indicates whether or not the user input is disabled.
properties.name: InputDisabled
properties.property_description: Boolean value that indicates whether or not the user input is disabled. If TRUE, user input has been disabled.

properties.description: Gets the participant's current state.
properties.name: State
properties.property_description: The participant's current state.

properties.description: Gets the control IDs of all the buttons this participant has interacted with.
properties.name: Buttons
properties.property_description: Array of button control IDs.

properties.description: Gets the control IDs of all the joystick controls this participant has interacted with.
properties.name: Joysticks
properties.property_description: Array of joystick control IDs.

api.name: BeamScene
api.description: Represents a Beam Interactive scene. These scenes are configured using the Beam Interactive Studio.

properties.description: Gets the unique string identifier for the scene.
properties.name: SceneID
properties.property_description: The unique string identifier for the scene.

properties.description: Gets all the buttons in the scene. This list may be empty.
properties.name: Buttons
properties.property_description: All the buttons in the scene.

properties.description: Gets all the joystick controls in the scene. This list may be empty.
properties.name: Joysticks
properties.property_description: All the joystick controls in the scene.

properties.description: Gets all the groups that are assigned to this scene.
properties.name: Buttons
properties.property_description: All the buttons in the scene.

methods.description: Gets a button control based on its ID, if it exists.
methods.name: GetButton(string)
methods.return_description: The button object.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Gets a joystick control based on its ID, if it exists.
methods.name: GetJoystick(string)
methods.return_description: The joystick object.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

api.name: BeamManager
api.description: The manager service class that handles the Beam Interactive event experience between Beam service and the title.

properties.description: Gets the singleton instance of the Beam manager.
properties.name: SingletonInstance
properties.property_description: The singleton instance of the Beam manager.

properties.description: Gets the level of information in the diagnostic output provided by the Beam SDK.
properties.name: LoggingLevel
properties.property_description: The level of information provided in the logs.

properties.description: Gets the interactivity state of the Beam manager.
properties.name: IsInteractive
properties.property_description: The interactivity state of the Beam manager.

properties.description: Gets all the groups associated with the current interactivity instance. Will be empty if initialization is not complete.
properties.name: Groups
properties.property_description: All the groups.

properties.description: Gets all the scenes associated with the current interactive instance. An empty list is returned if initialization is not completed.
properties.name: Scenes
properties.property_description: All the scenes.

properties.description: Gets all the participants.
properties.name: Participants
properties.property_description: All the participants.

properties.description: Gets all button controls.
properties.name: Buttons
properties.property_description: All button controls.

properties.description: Gets all joystick controls.
properties.name: Joysticks
properties.property_description: All joystick controls.

properties.description: Gets the string code that the broadcaster inputs on the Beam website to authorize the interactive session.
properties.name: ShortCode
properties.property_description: The string code used for authorization.

methods.description: Gets a specific group. Returns NULL if initialization is not yet completed or if the group does not exist.
methods.name: GetGroup(string groupID)
methods.return_description: The group object.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the group.

methods.description: Gets a specific scene. Returns NULL if initialization is not yet completed or if the group does not exist.
methods.name: GetScene(string sceneID)
methods.return_description: The scene object.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the scene.

methods.description: Sets up connection to the Beam interactivity service by initializing a background task.
methods.name: Initialize(bool)

params.param_description: Value that indicates whether interactivity should start after initialization. If TRUE, the stream enters into interactivity after initialization. This value defaults to TRUE.

methods.code: public void TriggerCooldown(string controlID, int cooldown)
methods.description: Disables a specified control for a period of time.
methods.name: TriggerCooldown(string, int)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control to disable.
The cooldown duration (in milliseconds).

methods.description: Used by the title to inform the Beam service that it is ready to receive interactive input. Returns a soft failure if initialization has not yet been completed. Returns a descriptive error message if initialization fails.
methods.name: StartInteractive()

methods.description: Used by the title to inform the Beam service that it is no longer receiving interactive input.
methods.name: StopInteractive()

methods.description: Manages and maintains proper state updates between the title and the Beam Service. To ensure best performance, DoWork() must be called frequently, such as once per frame. Title needs to be thread safe when calling DoWork() since this is when states are changed.
methods.name: DoWork()

methods.description: Closes the web socket and free the resources used by Beam manager.
methods.name: Dispose()

methods.description: Sends the specified text message as a mock web socket message.
methods.name: SendMockWebSocketMessage(string)

params.param_description: The text message to send.

methods.description: Gets a button control object by ID.
methods.name: GetButton(string)
methods.return_description: The button object.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Gets a joystick control object by ID.
methods.name: GetJoystick(string)
methods.return_description: The joystick object.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

api.name: BeamEventArgs
api.description: Base class for all Beam Interactive events. Contains info about the Beam event. Beam Interactive is an event-driven service.

constructor_class.description: Creates the Beam event args class.
constructor_class.name: BeamEventArgs()

properties.description: Gets the time (in UTC) when this event is raised.
properties.name: time()
properties.property_description: The time (in UTC).

properties.description: Gets the error code indicating the result of the operation.
properties.name: ErrorCode
properties.property_description: The error code.

properties.description: Gets call-specific error message with debug information. Message is not localized as it is meant to be used for debugging only.
properties.name: ErrorMessage
properties.property_description: The error message.

properties.description: Gets the type of event raised.
properties.name: EventType
properties.property_description: The type of event raised.

api.name: BeamButtonEventArgs
api.description: Contains information for a button event.

properties.description: Gets the unique string identifier for this control.
properties.name: ControlID
properties.property_description: The unique string identifier for this control.

properties.description: Gets the user who triggered this event.
properties.name: Participant
properties.property_description: The user who triggered this event.

properties.description: Get the value that indicates whether the button is pressed down or not. Returns TRUE if button is pressed down.
properties.name: IsPressed
properties.property_description: Value that indicates whether the button is down or not.

api.name: BeamJoystickEventArgs
api.description: Contains information for a joystick event. These events are sent at an interval frequency configured via the Beam Lab.

properties.description: Gets the unique string identifier for this control.
properties.name: ControlID
properties.property_description: The unique string identifier for this control.

properties.description: Gets the X coordinate of the joystick, in the range of [-1, 1].
properties.name: X
properties.property_description: The X coordinate of the joystick.

properties.description: Gets the Y coordinate of the joystick, in the range of [-1, 1].
properties.name: Y
properties.property_description: The Y coordinate of the joystick.

properties.description: Gets the user who raised this event.
properties.name: Participant
properties.property_description: The user who raised this event.

api.name: BeamDialog
api.description: Represents a custom Beam dialog box for displaying the short code for authentication to the Beam service in Unity.

methods.description: Display the code dialog box on screen.
methods.name: Show(string)

params.param_description: The identifier code for the dialog box.

methods.description: Hide the code dialog box.
methods.name: Hide(string)

params.param_description: The identifier code for the dialog box.

api.name: BeamControl
api.description: Base class for all Beam Interactive controls. All controls are created and configured using the Beam Lab.

properties.description: Gets the unique string identifier for this control.
properties.name: ControlId
properties.property_description: The unique string identifier for this control.

properties.description: Gets the value that indicates whether the control is enabled or disabled.
properties.name: Disabled
properties.property_description: Boolean value that indicates whether the control is enabled or disabled.

properties.description: Gets the help text that displays when a participant hovers over the control.
properties.name: HelpText
properties.property_description: The help text.

methods.description: Function to enable or disable this control.
methods.name: SetEnabled(bool)

params.param_description: Boolean value to enable or disable the control. Set this value to TRUE to disable the control.

api.name: BeamGroup
api.description: Represents a Beam Interactivity group. This group functionality is used to segment your audience watching a stream. BeamGroup is useful when you want groups of your audience to be shown a different scene while watching a stream. In a scenario where you want the same scene to be shown to multiple groups, you need to ensure that each participant is only in a single group.

properties.description: Gets the unique string identifier for this group.
properties.name: GroupID
properties.property_description: The unique string identifier.

properties.description: Gets the scene shown to this group.
properties.name: SceneID
properties.property_description: The scene shown to this group.

methods.description: Function to set the scene assigned for this group to the specified scene ID.
methods.name: SetScene(string)

params.param_description: String value that specifies the target scene to set for the group.

api.name: BeamButtonControl
api.description: Represents a Beam Interactive button control. This class is derived from BeamControl. All controls are created and configured using the Beam Lab.

properties.description: Gets the text displayed on the button control.
properties.name: ButtonText
properties.property_description: The text displayed on the button control.

properties.description: Gets the spark cost assigned to the button control.
properties.name: Cost
properties.property_description: The spark cost.

properties.description: Gets the time remaining (in milliseconds) before this button can be clicked again.
properties.name: RemainingCooldown
properties.property_description: The time remaining (in milliseconds).

properties.description: Gets the current progress of this button control.
properties.name: Progress
properties.property_description: Current progress.

properties.description: Indicates whether the button has transitioned from up to down since the last call to DoWork().
properties.name: ButtonDown
properties.property_description: Value that indicates whether the button has transitioned from up to down.

properties.description: Indicates whether the button is pressed since the last call to DoWork().
properties.name: ButtonPressed
properties.property_description: Value that indicates whether the button is pressed.

properties.description: Indicates whether the button has transitioned from down to up since the last call to DoWork().
properties.name: ButtonUp
properties.property_description: Value that indicates whether the button has transitioned from down to up.

properties.description: Gets the number of button downs since the last call to DoWork().
properties.name: CountOfButtonDowns
properties.property_description: The number of button downs.

properties.description: Gets the number of button presses since the last call to DoWork().
properties.name: CountOfButtonPresses
properties.property_description: The number of button presses.

properties.description: Gets the number of button ups since the last call to DoWork().
properties.name: CountOfButtonUps
properties.property_description: The number of button ups.

methods.description: Sets the progress value for this button control.
methods.name: SetProgress(float)

params.param_description: The progress value, in the range of 0.0 to 1.0.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if the specified Beam participant has triggered a button down since the last call to DoWork().
methods.name: GetButtonDown(uint)
methods.return_description: Value that indicates if the button is down or not.

params.param_description: The unique identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if the specified Beam participant has triggered a button press since the last call to DoWork().
methods.name: GetButtonPressed(uint)
methods.return_description: Value that indicates if the button has been pressed or not.

params.param_description: The unique identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns TRUE if the specified Beam participant has triggered a button up since the last call to DoWork().
methods.name: GetButtonUp(uint)
methods.return_description: Value that indicates if the button is up or not.

params.param_description: The unique identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns the number of button downs from the specified Beam participant since the last call to DoWork()
methods.name: GetCountOfButtonDowns(uint)
methods.return_description: The number of button downs.

params.param_description: The unique identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns the number of button presses from the specified Beam participant since the last call to DoWork()
methods.name: GetCountOfButtonPresses(uint)
methods.return_description: The number of button presses.

params.param_description: The unique identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Returns the number of button ups from the specified Beam participant since the last call to DoWork()
methods.name: GetCountOfButtonUps(uint)
methods.return_description: The number of button ups.

params.param_description: The unique identifier of the Beam participant.

api.name: BeamJoystickControl
api.description: Represents a Beam Interactive joystick control. This class is derived from BeamControl. All controls are created and configured using the Beam Lab.

constructor_class.code: public BeamJoystickControl(string controlID, bool enabled, string helpText, string eTag, string sceneID)
constructor_class.description: Creates the Beam Interactive joystick control class.
constructor_class.name: BeamJoystickControl(string, bool, string, string, string)

properties.description: Gets the current X coordinate of the joystick, in the range of [-1, 1].
properties.name: X
properties.property_description: The current X coordinate of the joystick.

properties.description: Gets the current Y coordinate of the joystick, in the range of [-1, 1].
properties.name: Y
properties.property_description: The current Y coordinate of the joystick.

properties.description: Gets the current intensity of the joystick control, in the range of [0, 1].
properties.name: Intensity
properties.property_description: The current intensity of the joystick.

methods.description: Gets the X coordinate of the joystick for a particular Beam participant since the last DoWork() call.
methods.name: GetX(uint)

params.param_description: The unique identifier of the Beam participant.

methods.description: Gets the Y coordinate of the joystick for a particular Beam participant since the last DoWork() call.
methods.name: GetY(uint)

params.param_description: The unique identifier of the Beam participant.

api.name: BeamLoggingLevel
api.description: Describes the various levels of logging configuration provided by the Beam SDK.

enums.name: Verbose
enums.description: All events, including every websocket and HTTP message.

api.name: BeamEventType
api.description: Describes the types of Beam events.

enums.name: Error
enums.description: This event is raised when the service or manager encounters an error. The Error and ErrorMessage members will contain pertinent info.

enums.name: InteractivityStateChanged
enums.description: This event is raised when the interactivity state of the Beam manager has changed.

enums.name: ParticipantStateChanged
enums.description: This event is raised when a participant's state changes. For example, when the participant joins, leaves, or has input disabled.

enums.name: Button
enums.description: This event is raised when there is button input.

enums.name: Joystick
enums.description: This event is raised when there is joystick input.

api.name: BeamInteractivityState
api.description: Describes the current state of the interactivity service. State transitions available: NotInitialized -> NotInteractive, NotInteractive -> InteractivePending, InteractivePending -> Interactive, Interactive -> NotInteractive

enums.name: NotInitialized
enums.description: The Beam manager is not initalized.

enums.name: Initializing
enums.description: The beam manager is in the process of initializing.

enums.name: ShortCodeRequired
enums.description: The Beam manager requires the user to be authenticated with the service. User needs to go to the Beam website to enter a code.

enums.name: InteractivityDisabled
enums.description: The beam manager is initialized, but interactivity is not enabled.

enums.name: InteractivePending
enums.description: Currently connecting to the interactivity service.

api.name: BeamInteractivityStateChangedEventArgs
api.description: Contains information about the Beam manager's latest interactivity state.

properties.description: Gets the Beam manager's latest interactivity state.
properties.name: State
properties.property_description: The Beam manager's latest interactivity state.

api.name: BeamParticipantState
api.description: Describes the current state of the participant.

api.name: BeamParticipantStateChangedEventArgs
api.description: Contains information about the participant's state change event. This event is raised when a participant joins or leaves the Beam channel.

properties.description: Gets the participant whose state has changed. It can be a participant has just joined or left the Beam channel.
properties.name: Participant
properties.property_description: The participant who has just joined the Beam channel.

properties.description: Gets the participant's current state.
properties.name: State
properties.property_description: The participant's current state.

api.name: Beam
api.description: Represents the Beam class object in Unity. Add this class to your title when you want it to go interactive. This class enables viewers to interact with a Beam interactive game scene made in Unity by managing state changes and event handlers.

properties.description: Gets the interactivity state of the Beam manager.
properties.name: IsInteractive
properties.property_description: The interactivity state of the Beam manager.

properties.description: Gets all the scenes associated with the current interactive instance.
properties.name: Scenes
properties.property_description: All the scenes.

properties.description: Gets all the participants.
properties.name: Participants
properties.property_description: All the participants.

properties.description: Gets all button controls.
properties.name: Buttons
properties.property_description: All button controls.

properties.description: Gets all joystick controls.
properties.name: Joysticks
properties.property_description: All joystick controls.

properties.description: Gets the string code that the broadcaster inputs on the Beam website to authorize the interactive session.
properties.name: ShortCode
properties.property_description: The string code used for authorization.

methods.description: Sets up connection to the Beam interactivity service by initializing a background task.
methods.name: Initialize(bool)

params.param_description: Value that indicates whether interactivity should start after initialization. If TRUE, the stream enters into interactivity after initialization. This value defaults to TRUE.

methods.code: public void TriggerCooldown(string controlID, int cooldown)
methods.description: Disables a specified control for a period of time.
methods.name: TriggerCooldown(string, int)

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control to disable.
The cooldown duration (in milliseconds).

methods.description: Used by the title to inform the Beam service that it is ready to receive interactive input. Returns a soft failure if initialization has not yet been completed. Returns a descriptive error message if initialization fails.
methods.name: StartInteractive()

methods.description: Used by the title to inform the Beam service that it is no longer receiving interactive input.
methods.name: StopInteractive()

methods.description: Manages and maintains proper state updates between the title and the Beam Service. To ensure best performance, DoWork() must be called frequently, such as once per frame. Title needs to be thread safe when calling DoWork() since this is when states are changed.
methods.name: DoWork()

methods.description: Closes the web socket and free the resources used by Beam manager.
methods.name: Dispose()

methods.description: Sends the specified text message as a mock web socket message.
methods.name: SendMockWebSocketMessage(string)

params.param_description: The text message to send.

methods.description: Indicates whether the button is currently pressed down. If TRUE, the button is down.
methods.name: GetButtonDown(string)
methods.return_description: Value that indicates whether the button is currently pressed down.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Indicates whether the button is currently pressed. If TRUE, the button is pressed.
methods.name: GetButton(string)
methods.return_description: Value that indicates whether the button is currently pressed.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Indicates whether the button is currently up. If TRUE, the button is up.
methods.name: GetButtonDown(string)
methods.return_description: Value that indicates whether the button is currently pressed up.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Gets the number of buttons with the specified control ID that are pressed down.
methods.name: GetButtonDownCount(string)
methods.return_description: The number of buttons that are pressed down.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Gets the number of buttons with the specified control ID that are pressed.
methods.name: GetButtonCount(string)
methods.return_description: The number of buttons that are pressed.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Gets the number of buttons with the specified control ID that are up.
methods.name: GetButtonUpCount(string)
methods.return_description: The number of buttons that are up.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Gets the X coordinate of a particular joystick.
methods.name: GetJoystickX(string)
methods.return_description: The X coordinate of a joystick.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Gets the X coordinate of a particular joystick.
methods.name: GetJoystickY(string)
methods.return_description: The Y coordinate of a joystick.

params.param_description: The unique string identifier of the control.

methods.description: Connects to the Beam service and informs the service that the BeamManager is ready to recieve messages. This method also handles authentication events, if necessary.
methods.name: GoInteractive()

methods.code: public delegate void OnGointeractiveHandler(object sender, EventArgs e)
methods.description: The delegate type that defines the set of arguments that are passed to the method that handles the title's interactivity change event.
methods.name: OnGointeractiveHandler(object, EventArgs)

params.param_description: The Beam manager.
Contains information about the title's interactivity.

methods.code: public delegate void OnErrorEventHandler(object sender, BeamEventArgs e)
methods.description: The delegate type that defines the set of arguments that are passed to the method that handles an error event.
methods.name: OnErrorEventHandler(object, BeamEventArgs)

params.param_description: The Beam manager.
Contains information about the error event.

methods.code: public delegate void OnInteractivityStateChangedHandler(object sender, BeamInteractivityStateChangedEventArgs e)
methods.description: The delegate type that defines the set of arguments that are passed to the method that handles the interactivity state change event.
methods.name: OnInteractivityStateChangedHandler(object, BeamInteractivityStateChangedEventArgs)

params.param_description: The Beam manager.
Contains information about the interactivity state change event.

methods.code: public delegate void OnParticipantStateChangedHandler(object sender, BeamEventArgs e)
methods.description: The delegate type that defines the set of arguments that are passed to the method that handles the participant state change event.
methods.name: OnParticipantStateChangedHandler(object, BeamEventArgs)

params.param_description: The participant.
Contains information about the participant state change event.

methods.code: public delegate void OnBeamButtonEventHandler(object sender, BeamButtonEventArgs e)
methods.description: The delegate type that defines the set of arguments that are passed to the method that handles the button state change event.
methods.name: OnBeamButtonEventHandler(object, BeamButtonEventArgs)

params.param_description: The button.
Contains information about the button change event

methods.code: public delegate void OnBeamJoystickControlEventHandler(object sender, BeamJoystickEventArgs e)
methods.description: The delegate type that defines the set of arguments that are passed to the method that handles the button state change event.
methods.name: OnBeamJoystickControlEventHandler(object, BeamJoystickEventArgs)

params.param_description: The joystick.
Contains information about the joystick change event
